2023-07-29T16:27:43Z: Thank you for sticking with us through the various delays. We'll bring the Live text page to a close there, but be sure to keep an eye on the website over the coming hours for all the news and reaction from Spa - and of course, join us tomorrow for the race at 2pm BST. Until next time, we'll see you then!
2023-07-29T16:26:27Z: Belgian racing legend Jacky Ickx was on hand to distribute the top three with their commemorative plaques. Verstappen will be hoping to get his hands on a slightly bigger piece of silverware tomorrow, but will have a tougher time on his hands coming through from sixth on the grid after his gearbox change. Based on his pace today though, don't write him off...
2023-07-29T16:24:00Z: Here's the full report in case you missed any of the drama: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-belgian-gp-verstappen-wins-shortened-sprint-race-from-piastri-gasly/10501846/
2023-07-29T16:22:58Z: Those six points for Gasly from the sprint match his best haul all season for Alpine, for finishing seventh in Monaco.
2023-07-29T16:19:26Z: The biggest celebrations after that result, unsurprisingly, are in the Alpine camp as Gasly is embraced by his mechanics. Some light at the end of the tunnel, finally, after a mixed first season in blue.
2023-07-29T16:17:49Z: Hamilton does however finish ahead of team-mate Russell, who put in some good moves into La Source on Ricciardo and Ocon. The AlphaTauri and Alpine drivers complete the top 10.
2023-07-29T16:17:05Z: That boosts Sainz to fourth ahead of Leclerc and Norris, whose assault on Leclerc proved short-lived.
2023-07-29T16:16:40Z: Gasly comes across the line third to bring Alpine some cheer amid what has been a difficult weekend, while Hamilton drops from fourth to seventh with his penalty.
2023-07-29T16:16:08Z: Verstappen had to briefly cede the lead, but he storms to sprint victory over Piastri by 6.6s. A remarkable margin considering he only took the position back five laps ago.
2023-07-29T16:15:22Z: Everybody is now having to search out wet patches to cool their intermediates. If this race had continued, a switch to slicks might not have been far off.
2023-07-29T16:14:16Z: Verstappen has started his final lap and is on a cruise to another maximum points haul.
2023-07-29T16:13:55Z: Hamilton looks no closer to deposing Gasly of third on the road. As it stands, Alpine look set for a sprint podium - a nice farewell to outgoing team boss Otmar Szafnauer and sporting director Alan Permane.
2023-07-29T16:12:53Z: Russell is going well in the other Mercedes and gets a better exit from the Bus Stop to cleanly pass Ricciardo for eighth.
2023-07-29T16:12:24Z: Hamilton has been issued a five-second time penalty for the earlier contact with Perez. As it stands, that will drop him a hatful of positions.
2023-07-29T16:11:40Z: Perez duly comes in to complete a miserable sprint race. Norris meanwhile has latched onto the tail of Leclerc in a battle for sixth.
2023-07-29T16:11:04Z: Verstappen now has clear air and has made good use of it. He's already north of 4s ahead of Piastri, who appears happy to settle for second.
2023-07-29T16:10:31Z: Russell is also on the move and now takes ninth from Ocon into La Source.
2023-07-29T16:09:41Z: Perez's woes continue as he's demoted a further place to 17th by Magnussen - who evidently has been talked out of a visit to the pits for slicks.
2023-07-29T16:09:09Z: The stewards are investigating the earlier contact between Hamilton and Perez, which occurred while they were side-by-side. Hamilton isn't letting it distract him though as he chases down Gasly. His hold on third isn't looking especially Fort Knox-like.
2023-07-29T16:08:25Z: Off goes Perez! He takes a visit to the gravel and loses a hatful of positions, rejoining 16th.
2023-07-29T16:06:54Z: Now Hamilton attacks down the outside into La Source and gets the move done to take fourth away from Perez, who also loses out to both Ferraris in short order. It's a brave move from Leclerc all the way around the outside of Les Combes, forcing Perez to yield.
2023-07-29T16:05:52Z: Contact! Hamilton dives down the inside of Perez on the exit of Stavelot but the Red Bull is having none of it.
2023-07-29T16:05:19Z: Gasly has kept his hold on third place over Perez and Hamilton, while in the pack Sargeant gets a five-second pitlane speeding penalty.
2023-07-29T16:04:45Z: Down the Kemmel Straight Verstappen blasts past Piastri to take the lead by the time they jump on the anchors into Les Combes. Easy as you like.
2023-07-29T16:04:16Z: We're back to green, and already Piastri is under attack from Verstappen!
2023-07-29T16:03:24Z: Out of Stavelot, Piastri backs the pack up. Verstappen nonchalantly takes the opportunity to throw away a tear-off from his visor.
2023-07-29T16:02:46Z: Magnussen says his Haas team should start to think about a switch to slicks as he reports there's a dry line already. Could anybody take the gamble after watching Alonso float off?
2023-07-29T16:02:00Z: Race control says the safety car will be in at the end of this, the fifth lap of the race. That means we'll have just five laps of green running left.
2023-07-29T16:00:36Z: Piastri is the leader, and probably won't mind winding a few laps away behind the safety car. Could he become the first driver to beat a Red Bull across the line at the end of a race this season, even if it's not a full grand prix?
2023-07-29T15:59:41Z: Replays show Alonso was taking a look at Hulkenberg and had tucked back in behind when the back end stepped out on him. The car spun around several times through the run off and gravel before coming to a rest just in front of the barriers.
2023-07-29T15:58:15Z: The Aston Martin driver climbs out, and the safety car is called. It's a strange place to go off, on the exit of Pouhon.
2023-07-29T15:57:37Z: Gasly is holding up a queue of cars behind the two leaders. As Sargeant has been notified to the stewards for pitlane speeding, Alonso finds the gravel!
2023-07-29T15:56:30Z: Verstappen isn't happy about Piastri taking the lead and takes a look up the inside into Les Combes. It's speculative at best though and he ducks back in behind.
2023-07-29T15:55:36Z: Hamilton had a slow stop as he was held in his box as others came into the pits behind him, costing him a spot to Perez. He's fifth, ahead of Sainz, Leclerc, Norris, Ricciardo and Ocon.
2023-07-29T15:54:52Z: Taking the stop at the first opportunity has promoted Piastri to the lead! Verstappen rejoins second, with Gasly now third ahead of Perez.
2023-07-29T15:53:46Z: Piastri has already passed Zhou, the last of the wet-shod runners. Everyone who didn't pit at the end of the formation lap now comes in.
2023-07-29T15:52:07Z: Out on the track Verstappen leads Leclerc, Norris, Ocon and Russell.
2023-07-29T15:51:49Z: Piastri and Sainz lead those who elect to pit at the first opportunity. They're followed in by Gasly, Hamilton and Perez.
2023-07-29T15:50:49Z: Verstappen holds the pack back and then accelerates on the approach to Pouhon. We're underway at last!
2023-07-29T15:48:58Z: This then appears to be 'the' formation lap, as the timing screens say the safety car will peel in at the end of this tour and a rolling start procedure will commence. The race distance is now 11 laps.
2023-07-29T15:47:07Z: Could anybody decide to take the plunge and pit? With the race distance not being especially long, you'd imagine there will be something of a herd mentality.
2023-07-29T15:44:34Z: The timing screens now say that the race duration will be 12 laps.
2023-07-29T15:39:23Z: The sprint race hasn't officially started yet, although the cars continue to circulate for another lap behind the safety car.
2023-07-29T15:38:02Z: Russell reports: “Please can you give me the gap to the cars ahead. I can’t even see them even on the straight.”
2023-07-29T15:36:22Z: Unsurprisingly, there's plenty of standing water on the track surface which is producing thick spray on the Kemmel Straight. I'd be amazed if the safety car came in any time soon.
2023-07-29T15:35:21Z: Off they go on the formation lap. Wet tyres all round.
2023-07-29T15:31:46Z: Just four minutes to go now until the formation lap gets underway. Starting behind the safety car, we don't know yet how many laps Bernd Maylander will be required to stay out in front of the pack.
2023-07-29T15:30:33Z: This being such a long lap, the gain/loss from going a lap longer before ditching tyres can be significant. Remember 2008, when Nick Heidfeld was driving past cars like they were in treacle thanks to a well-timed switch to wets?
2023-07-29T15:28:27Z: The FIA has mandated that the race will get going on wet weather tyres behind the safety car. The question then becomes one of when/if drivers will switch to inters.
2023-07-29T15:25:13Z: Given how heavy that downpour was, F1 made the right call. I remember watching the closing stages of the Spa 24 in 2016 where cars were just floating into the barriers on the approach to the Bus Stop. Excruciating.
2023-07-29T15:24:02Z: With the sun now out, the awnings protecting the cars are being folded away.
2023-07-29T15:22:15Z: Update - we have a time for the formation lap. It'll get going at 17:35 local time.
2023-07-29T15:19:26Z: A rainbow has appeared, and some umbrellas are coming down.
2023-07-29T15:17:57Z: You know who I feel sorry for most, aside from the fans? Photographers.
2023-07-29T15:16:45Z: Adam Cooper has secured pole position down at the post-race media pen. We think he's going to be there a while. But he is at least armed with a coffee courtesy of Matt Kew, showing his versatility as a barista.
2023-07-29T15:15:09Z: The current expectation is for rain to continue until around 20 past, then attempt a start behind the safety car, Norris is told. Clearly, F1 needs the weather to improve before letting the field loose.
2023-07-29T15:14:06Z: It's not exactly quiet at Spa though. The atmosphere-building DJs are still doing a roaring trade.
2023-07-29T15:11:58Z: Several drivers have now taken their helmets off, but remain in the car as it's the only dry seat in the house.
2023-07-29T15:08:20Z: Toto Wolff over the radio to George Russell says he's considering closing the doors of the garage to stop the rain flooding in. Russell isn't too keen on his idea of removing the awning to get the true feeling for how wet it's got.
2023-07-29T15:07:41Z: Now the timing screens are saying 'delayed start'. It seems like we're not going to be going in five minutes for the formation lap...
2023-07-29T15:04:41Z: It's properly wet now. Every car is now covered by an awning. The weather has clearly turned. Umbrellas everywhere in the grandstands.
2023-07-29T15:03:57Z: Well, the decision to delay further means there's no real benefit to anyone hoping to hold out on slicks and build up an advantage until the track got wetter.
2023-07-29T15:03:03Z: The formation lap will now begin in 10 minutes at 16:12 BST.
2023-07-29T15:01:05Z: Perhaps in light of that uncertainty, the start has been delayed.
2023-07-29T15:00:40Z: The uncertainty over the rain also makes life difficult from a set-up point of view. Do you sit on the fence with slicks and wet settings? Leclerc is informed that rain is heavy at Turn 15 and will last for 20 minutes.
2023-07-29T14:59:22Z: We say gamble, but it looks like some teams are changing tyres on the grid. They're still tucked up in blankets though, so we can't see which compounds they're on until seconds before the warmup lap starts and they are removed.
2023-07-29T14:56:22Z: The first corner at Spa is an inviting one for lunges. But the penalty you pay for a bad exit out of La Source is such that there's a huge chance of losing ground on the long run to Les Combes for taking a big risk, even if it doesn't result in damage. Let's see how much drivers are willing to take in the sprint, where comparatively few points are on offer.
2023-07-29T14:53:03Z: Helpfully, the timing screens tell us that the risk of rain for this session is 100%. Not even a smidgen of doubt.
2023-07-29T14:51:42Z: The cars are on the grid as start preparations get going in earnest. Alex Kalinauckas tells us it's spitting.
2023-07-29T14:46:32Z: If you're just joining us and wondering why there's no track action yet, it's because this morning's sprint qualifying shootout was delayed by heavy rain. And the F1 regulations state that the sprint race has to commence four and a half hours after the sprint shootout begins. Convoluted? You bet.
2023-07-29T14:42:27Z: Stroll shunted on the mediums he was obliged to use upon switching to slicks in SQ2 because the track was not declared wet by the FIA. Here's more on this scenario, which took teams by surprise: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-teams-surprised-by-fias-spa-shootout-tyre-call/10501743/
2023-07-29T14:42:09Z: As ever after such a session there was a range of contrasting emotions down the pitlane. Aston Martin had particular cause for frustration after Lance Stroll's crash, before he and team-mate Fernando Alonso had set a time, ensured both cars were eliminated in SQ2. They will start 14th (Stroll) and 15th (Alonso) respectively, after Alonso had been third in SQ1.
2023-07-29T14:38:36Z: The sprint shootout, as we're now getting used to calling it, produced an entertaining scrap for pole as Verstappen narrowly edged Oscar Piastri and Carlos Sainz. The damp and ever-improving track had more than a little to do with it, but it was exciting to see the top three split by just 0.025s. Getting close to Jerez 1997 territory, that...
2023-07-29T14:36:53Z: Good afternoon, and welcome back to Autosport's live coverage from Saturday track action at Spa. We're half an hour away from the sprint race, which Max Verstappen will start on pole.
2023-07-29T11:55:36Z: And with that, we bid you farewell until the sprint later on today. To catch up with all the action, here is the full Autosport report of sprint qualifying from the Belgian GP https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-belgian-gp-shootout/10501668/
2023-07-29T11:53:36Z: A distinct change in emotions from Sainz, who ended Friday disappointed. He will start the sprint race from P3 and he sets a podium as the objective.
2023-07-29T11:48:53Z: Hamilton's radio shows him repeatedly informing Mercedes that Russell had run wide at Turn 1, and indicating that his team-mate needs to get out of the way rather than hinder both of them.
2023-07-29T11:44:20Z: Piastri has suggested he will 'tie a rope' to Verstappen's Red Bull and be dragged around the track. That's one way to get a result, I guess.
2023-07-29T11:43:32Z: While the skies are blue around Spa at the moment, it is expected that there will be more rain before the sprint race. As if anything else was needed to spice this one up!
2023-07-29T11:37:12Z: The sprint will get underway at 4:05pm BST - a 35-minute delay on the original plan as a result of the pushback in qualifying.
2023-07-29T11:33:36Z: Apparent chaos off the track, but on it, Alpine enjoyed a positive session with Gasly P6 and Ocon P9.
2023-07-29T11:31:02Z: Replays are showing that Russell somewhat got in Hamilton's way at the start of their final laps. A lockup into Turn 1 put Hamilton on his tail, before the seven-time champion was forced to lift off later on.
2023-07-29T11:28:21Z: It has been another strong session for Ferrari, with Sainz and Leclerc P3/4 on the grid for today's sprint race. Norris completes the top five.
2023-07-29T11:27:37Z: Perez is only P8 in another somewhat underwhelming performance, although it should be noted that he had worse track conditions than many of those ahead of him.
2023-07-29T11:26:22Z: Pisatri is second by just 0.011! What a result from the rookie McLaren driver! Is there a driver of the day award for qualifying?
2023-07-29T11:25:34Z: Verstappen completes the session and is fastest! The Red Bull driver will start from pole position after registering a 1m49.056s.
2023-07-29T11:24:40Z: Sainz now toped the order as Leclerc goes P2.
2023-07-29T11:23:50Z: The chequered flag is out. Verstappen will be the last driver to register a time.
2023-07-29T11:23:24Z: Perez continued to push, however, and takes to the top with a 1m50.303s! Time is there to be had. He had significant traffic to negotiate at the Bus Stop chicane.
2023-07-29T11:22:00Z: But with a clear track, expect further improvements.
2023-07-29T11:21:42Z: All 10 drivers have set their first times with a Hamilton-Verstappen front row being the provisional result.
2023-07-29T11:21:09Z: Verstappen can only manage P2! He is one-tenth behind Hamilton.
2023-07-29T11:20:51Z: But Norris rediscovers his pace and goes faster, as does Hamilton. The Mercedes driver now leads the way with a 1m31.198s.
2023-07-29T11:20:15Z: A 1m52.265s to open things for Leclerc. Sainz goes P2.
2023-07-29T11:18:07Z: Drivers will probably try for two push laps, separated by a recharge, slower effort.
2023-07-29T11:17:24Z: Slick, soft tyres for everyone as SQ3 begins.
2023-07-29T11:16:06Z: The FIA has confirmed the track was intentionally not declared as being wet to prevent teams from running whichever slick tyres they wanted. Bizarre.
2023-07-29T11:15:19Z: SQ3 will begin at 1315 local, 1215 BST. With only eight minutes in which to set a time, slicks may need to be fitted immediately.
2023-07-29T11:11:33Z: It has now been clarified that because the FIA never declared the track as being wet in SQ2, Stroll had to run new medium tyres and not soft rubber. Given intermediate tyres were used and were kicking up spray, it's certainly an interesting interpretation of that being a 'dry' track.
2023-07-29T11:09:37Z: In SQ3, we will have two Red Bulls, two Mercedes, two Ferraris, two McLarens and two Alpines.
2023-07-29T11:08:45Z: As was the case in SQ1, Russell was the slowest driver to make the cut and progress. He really is living on the edge in this session!
2023-07-29T11:05:31Z: Ricciardo, Albon, Sargeant, Stroll and Alonso are the five that we lose at this point.
2023-07-29T11:05:12Z: Official confirmation that SQ2 will not be resumed.
2023-07-29T11:04:46Z: That's disastrous for Aston Martin, with Alonso not having completed a lap. The pair are P14 and 15.
2023-07-29T11:04:17Z: Stroll is off and he destroys the front end of his Aston Martin.
2023-07-29T11:02:28Z: This is a true win it or bin it SQ2 effort from Stroll.
2023-07-29T11:02:10Z: Alonso and Albon have finally left the garage but both are on mediums.
2023-07-29T11:01:51Z: Here we go. Stoll has pitted for medium tyres. It's too late for anyone who has not yet pitted to make the switch.
2023-07-29T11:01:21Z: Hamilton and Gasly leap to the top. A 1m55.823s is the target time.
2023-07-29T11:00:39Z: A spin for Sargeant but he continues and doesn't interrupt anyone's laps.
2023-07-29T10:59:48Z: The track looks borderline for slicks now, so there may be a few drivers bailing on their current efforts in order to switch to slicks.
2023-07-29T10:59:09Z: Norris immediately topples the time with a 1m56.828s.
2023-07-29T10:58:36Z: Only Alonso and Albon remain in the garage, as Ricciardo puts in a 1m57.687s to kick things off in SQ2.
2023-07-29T10:56:29Z: Now, the track is getting far busier.
2023-07-29T10:55:38Z: Ricciardo is the first driver to leave the garage for the 10-minute session, with Norris the only other man to join him.
2023-07-29T10:52:40Z: With Piastri P11 and Norris P13 in that session, there will be questions as to where McLaren's pace has gone after a strong Friday.
2023-07-29T10:50:00Z: Tsunoda, Bottas, Magnussen, Zhou and Hulkenberg are the five who end their sessions early.
2023-07-29T10:49:29Z: Russell survives by the skin of his teeth as Bottas pits.
2023-07-29T10:49:06Z: Norris is safe, climbing to P13.
2023-07-29T10:48:27Z: Alonso goes to P2. Norris is still down there as things stand.
2023-07-29T10:48:06Z: Sargeant leaps up to P7 from the drop zone!
2023-07-29T10:47:50Z: Hulkenberg set no time after trying to be clever and gain the best conditions of the session.
2023-07-29T10:47:27Z: Hulkenberg is out. He didn't make the line in time!
2023-07-29T10:47:07Z: The chequered flag has fallen on SQ1.
2023-07-29T10:46:33Z: At this point, Norris, Stroll, Sargeant, Magnussen and Hulkenberg are the five in the drop zone.
2023-07-29T10:46:11Z: With one minute remaining, there are no real fast times being completed as drivers harvest electrical energy to be ready for one final dash.
2023-07-29T10:45:03Z: Hamilton has been cleared of impeding Verstappen, with no further action required.
2023-07-29T10:44:29Z: Aston Martin appear to be struggling badly in these conditions with Alonso going P13 with his latest effort and dropping Stroll into the bottom five.
2023-07-29T10:43:49Z: And there goes Verstappen - smashing Sainz's time with a 1m58.958s.
2023-07-29T10:43:23Z: Sainz now goes fastest and is the first driver to drop under the two-minute mark. These times will continue to drop rapidly as the track improves.
2023-07-29T10:42:30Z: A Turn 8 incident for potential impeding between Verstappen and Hamilton has been noted by the FIA stewards. No investigation yet.
2023-07-29T10:41:59Z: And it's top for Verstappen. 2m.00.352s is the benchmark with Russell and Perez completing the top three.
2023-07-29T10:41:26Z: Albon is third but here comes Verstappen, setting a purple sector two.
2023-07-29T10:41:06Z: As was the case on Friday, Piastri is shining across a single lap, going top from Leclerc with a 2m01.311s.
2023-07-29T10:40:29Z: Magnussen elects not to complete his effort and pulls into the pits. Not too sure as to why right now.
2023-07-29T10:39:42Z: Russell is three seconds slower with Bottas slotting between the Mercedes pair.
2023-07-29T10:39:24Z: The first time then - a 2m02.297s from Hamilton.
2023-07-29T10:38:52Z: The first timed laps are nearing completion with Hamilton - as the first driver on track - going purple in all sectors.
2023-07-29T10:36:02Z: We have 12 minutes of action before we lose the slowest five drivers - a shortened but familiar qualifying format.
2023-07-29T10:35:28Z: SQ1 is GO! Lewis Hamilton is the first driver to leave the pitlane.
2023-07-29T10:32:29Z: Three minutes before we get going.
2023-07-29T10:30:37Z: Intermediate tyres have been fitted to all the cars that have left the garages.
2023-07-29T10:30:05Z: With six minutes to go before we begin, the two Mercedes and two Alfa Romeo cars have ventured to the end of the pitlane. While typing, the Haas cars have joined them.
2023-07-29T10:28:54Z: Watching the track condition indicator is a hugely entertaining experience, with the binary wet/dry metre flicking almost minute by minute. Currently, no rain is shown as falling.
2023-07-29T10:22:42Z: But cricketing memories aside, at least the action will get going again soon.
2023-07-29T10:21:30Z: When the track looks like slicks aren't far away from being needed, announcing a start time 16 minutes in the future is similar to taking lunch when conditions would allow sport to continue.
2023-07-29T10:19:38Z: We have a time! Sprint qualifying will begin at 1235 local time, 1135 BST.
2023-07-29T10:17:31Z: SQ1 should have just finished - but we are yet to see any action. It doesn't look to be far off, however, with drivers getting into their cars.
2023-07-29T10:14:51Z: However, the FIA timing page three - for those interested in that kind of thing - has indicated rain is now falling again.
2023-07-29T10:14:10Z: The safety car is about to go for a tour of the track and, fingers crossed, we should have an answer on when we can get going.
2023-07-29T10:11:55Z: The rain is no longer falling and we are just waiting for the announcement that sprint qualifying can get underway.
2023-07-29T10:07:57Z: Leclerc will start Sunday's race from pole position after Verstappen was relegated due to his gearbox penalty. Alex Kalinauckas looks at how the Ferrari man has improved his fortunes.https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/how-leclerc-went-from-spain-q1-exit-to-spa-pole-in-similar-condition/10501603/
2023-07-29T10:02:39Z: Norris is clearly not expecting to get underway any time soon, with the McLaren driver sitting, chatting with his mechanics in the garage.
2023-07-29T10:01:02Z: The good news, for those hoping for some action, is that the weather front looks like it should clear the area at around 1215 local time, 1115 BST.
2023-07-29T09:58:20Z: Alpine has been a team in a seemingly constant period of change in recent times. The departures of Szafnaurer, Permane and Fry were announced this weekend and Jonathan Noble has cast his eye across the situation.https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/a-team-in-chaos-or-part-of-a-masterplan-whats-going-on-at-alpine-f1/10501582/
2023-07-29T09:54:36Z: The rain is reportedly easing in the pitlane but, given how Spa often sees different weather on different parts of the layout, this cannot be taken as a universal forecast.
2023-07-29T09:50:58Z: As expected given the conditions, sprint qualifying has been delayed with no expected time to get things underway indicated.
2023-07-29T09:49:11Z: As you may have seen this morning, F3 provided some very interesting action, with confusion as to whether points will or will not be awarded given that at no point were two consecutive laps completed without a safety car intervention. https://www.autosport.com/fia-f3/news/f3-spa-no-points-for-collets-sprint-win-amid-safety-car-disruption/10501569/
2023-07-29T09:46:40Z: As has often been the case this weekend, rain is falling on the circuit. Whether SPQ will be delayed remains to be seen.
2023-07-29T09:46:03Z: Max Verstappen was the fastest man on Friday but will start Sunday's race from sixth after changing his gearbox for the weekend. But he is free from sanction today, so is able to start from the front - should he qualify there!
2023-07-29T09:44:47Z: Good morning and welcome to our coverage of sprint qualifying from the Belgian Grand Prix.
